titleStmt.title: The Kings Maiesties last speech in the Isle of Weight [sic]. Concerning a hot game to bee plaid in the moneth of May; and a declaration of his Majesties proceedings at Carisbrooke castle, touching the present affairs of the kingdom of England. With an exact relation of the last fight, betwixt the Parliaments forces, and Col. Poyer, and the number of men slain and taken. Also, the proceedings of the inhabitants in the West and the full particulars touching his Highnesse the Prince of Wales, and the Scots.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
